hook.text: Gonorrhea has infected humans for thousands of years and is now becoming harder to treat than ever.

buildup.text: The bacterium Neisseria gonorrhoeae attacks mucous membranes in the genitals, throat, and rectum.

discovery.text: Symptoms can include painful urination and discharge, but many carriers show no signs at all.

twist.text: Gonorrhea has developed resistance to nearly every antibiotic used against it over the decades.

climax.text: Antibiotic-resistant gonorrhea is now on the WHO's urgent threat list for global public health.

punchline.text: An ancient infection learning new defenses.

quiz.question: Why is gonorrhea a growing public health concern?
